verses.text: Hold not thy peace , O God of my praise ; \q1

For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.\f + \fr 109.2 \ft of the deceitful: Heb. of deceit\f*\f + \fr 109.2 \ft are opened: Heb. have opened themselves\f* \q1
They compassed me about also with words of hatred ; and fought against me without a cause. \q1
For my love they are my adversaries : but I \add give myself unto\add* prayer. \q1
And they have rewarded me evil for good , and hatred for my love. \b \q1
Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.\f + \fr 109.6 \ft Satan: or, an adversary\f* \q1
When he shall be judged , let him be condemned : and let his prayer become sin.\f + \fr 109.7 \ft be condemned: Heb. go out guilty, or, wicked\f* \q1
Let his days be few ; \add and\add* let another take his office.\f + \fr 109.8 \ft office: or, charge\f* \q1
Let his children be fatherless , and his wife a widow. \q1
Let his children be continually vagabonds , and beg : let them seek \add their bread\add* also out of their desolate places. \q1
Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour. \q1
Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children. \q1
Let his posterity be cut off ; \add and\add* in the generation following let their name be blotted out. \q1
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out. \q1
Let them be before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* continually , that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth. \q1
Because that he remembered not to shew mercy , but persecuted the poor and needy man , that he might even slay the broken in heart. \q1
As he loved cursing , so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing , so let it be far from him. \q1
As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment , so let it come into his bowels like water , and like oil into his bones.\f + \fr 109.18 \ft into his bowels: Heb. within him\f* \q1
Let it be unto him as the garment \add which\add* covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually. \q1
\add Let\add* this \add be\add* the reward of mine adversaries from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and of them that speak evil against my soul. \b \q1
But do thou for me, O \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd* the Lord , for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy \add is\add* good , deliver thou me. \q1
For I \add am\add* poor and needy , and my heart is wounded within me. \q1
I am gone like the shadow when it declineth : I am tossed up and down as the locust. \q1
My knees are weak through fasting ; and my flesh faileth of fatness. \q1
I became also a reproach unto them: \add when\add* they looked upon me they shaked their heads. \q1
Help me, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* my God : O save me according to thy mercy : \q1
That they may know that this \add is\add* thy hand ; \add that\add* thou, \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, hast done it. \q1
Let them curse , but bless thou: when they arise , let them be ashamed ; but let thy servant rejoice. \q1
Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame , and let them cover themselves with their own confusion , as with a mantle. \q1
I will greatly praise the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* with my mouth ; yea, I will praise him among the multitude. \q1
For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor , to save \add him\add* from those that condemn his soul.\f + \fr 109.31 \ft those…: Heb. the judges of\f*
